lines.text: Yes. He loves the Sahara. We all do. By "we", I mean the professional military.
I'm not a military man, captain. War holds no romance for me. The side effects are repulsive.
Here there are no side effects. No women, no children, no towns to get in the way, just men, my doctor.
She stays with us. She has to stay with us. She's an integral part of the convoy, on the official bill of lading. She's yours, doctor, all yours.
I don't care whether you pay her off in lollipops or cut out her tongue with a dull knife. She's your responsibility.
